On Thu, 2004-07-08 at 12:23, Gordon Mohr (@Internet Archive) wrote:
> You need the '+' in the User-Agent, exactly as the template shows, inside the
> parenthesis before the URL.

That was it, now it works beautifully.  Thanks!

> We should probably relax and better document this; it's been a point of
> confusion for others as well.

A better error message would be great.

Other things I ran across in this little run:

The date stamp used for the file name uses GMT rather than localtime, I
just created this arc file where the time in the name isn't the same as
the time on the file itself:
-rw-rw-r--    1 lc       lc        1425953 Jul  8 12:33 IAH-20040708103136-00001-pc770.sb.statsbiblioteket.dk.arc.gz
Getting the time right with daylights savings is a little tricky, but I
believe I have some code for it somewhere.

I was following the progress by reloading the crawl job report page. 
When I reloaded after the job was finished, I got

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.archive.crawler.jspc.admin.reports.crawljob_jsp._jspService(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.jasper.runtime.HttpJspBase.service(HttpJspBase.java:137)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:853)
	at org.mortbay.jetty.servlet.ServletHolder.handle(ServletHolder.java:354)
	at org.mortbay.jetty.servlet.WebApplicationHandler.dispatch(WebApplicationHandler.java:294)
	at org.mortbay.jetty.servlet.ServletHandler.handle(ServletHandler.java:567)
	at org.mortbay.http.HttpContext.handle(HttpContext.java:1808)
	at org.mortbay.jetty.servlet.WebApplicationContext.handle(WebApplicationContext.java:525)
	at org.mortbay.http.HttpContext.handle(HttpContext.java:1758)
	at org.mortbay.http.HttpServer.service(HttpServer.java:879)
	at org.mortbay.http.HttpConnection.service(HttpConnection.java:790)
	at org.mortbay.http.HttpConnection.handleNext(HttpConnection.java:952)
	at org.mortbay.http.HttpConnection.handle(HttpConnection.java:807)
	at org.mortbay.http.SocketListener.handleConnection(SocketListener.java:197)
	at org.mortbay.util.ThreadedServer.handle(ThreadedServer.java:289)
	at org.mortbay.util.ThreadPool$PoolThread.run(ThreadPool.java:501)

It was a small crawl, yet it made three arc files.  I thought they were
suppose to go up to 100MB each, so why did I get

-rw-rw-r--    1 lc       lc          46310 Jul  8 12:32 IAH-20040708103136-00000-pc770.sb.statsbiblioteket.dk.arc.gz
-rw-rw-r--    1 lc       lc        1425953 Jul  8 12:33 IAH-20040708103136-00001-pc770.sb.statsbiblioteket.dk.arc.gz
-rw-rw-r--    1 lc       lc           2202 Jul  8 12:32 IAH-20040708103200-00002-pc770.sb.statsbiblioteket.dk.arc.gz

It's not that there's a system to what files are where.

The settings page is huge, it may be an idea (at some point) to figure
out which settings are the most frequently used, so the rest (which
should be most of them) can go in the expert settings.

Just my kr. 0.02.

-Lars
